      • GVRBitmapTexture

        public GVRBitmapTexture(GVRContext gvrContext,
                        int width,
                        int height,
                        byte[] grayscaleData)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a new, grayscale texture, from an array of luminance bytes.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - Current GVRContext
        width - Texture width, in pixels
        height - Texture height, in pixels
        grayscaleData - width * height bytes of gray scale data
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If width or height is <= 0, or if grayScaleData is null, or if grayscaleData.length < height * width
        Since:
        1.6.3

      • GVRBitmapTexture

        public GVRBitmapTexture(GVRContext gvrContext,
                        int width,
                        int height,
                        byte[] grayscaleData,
                        GVRTextureParameters textureParameters)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a new, grayscale texture, from an array of luminance bytes and the user defined filters GVRTextureParameters.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - Current GVRContext
        width - Texture width, in pixels
        height - Texture height, in pixels
        grayscaleData - width * height bytes of gray scale data
        textureParameters - User defined object for GVRTextureParameters which may also contain default values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If width or height is <= 0, or if grayScaleData is null, or if grayscaleData.length < height * width

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Boolean> update(int width,
                                                             int height,
                                                             byte[] grayscaleData)
        Copy new luminance data to a grayscale texture. This is also safe to be called in a non-GL thread.
        Parameters:
        width - Texture width, in pixels
        height - Texture height, in pixels
        grayscaleData - width * height bytes of gray scale data
        Returns:
        Future A update request on a non-GL thread will finally be forwarded to the GL thread and be executed before main rendering happens. So at the time we call the safeUpdate, we can only return a Future containing a boolean value to see if it is successfully updated later in GL thread.
        Since:
        1.6.3

      • update

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Boolean> update(Bitmap bitmap)
        Copy a new Bitmap to the GL texture. This one is also safe even in a non-GL thread. Creating a new GVRTexture is pretty cheap, but it's still not a totally trivial operation: it does involve some memory management and some GL hardware handshaking. Reusing the texture reduces this overhead (primarily by delaying garbage collection). Do be aware that updating a texture will affect any and all materials (and/or post effects) that use the texture!
        Parameters:
        bitmap - A standard Android Bitmap gvrContext Current GVR context we are running with.
        Returns:
        Future A update request on a non-GL thread will finally be forwarded to the GL thread and be executed before main rendering happens. So at the time we call the safeUpdate, we can only return a Future containing a boolean value to see if it is successfully updated later in GL thread.
        Since:
        1.6.3

      • idAvailable

        protected void idAvailable(int id)
        Description copied from class: GVRTexture
        Called from C++, on the GL thread; derived classes: call the super implementation first always!
        Overrides:
        idAvailable in class GVRTexture

      • postBuffer

        public void postBuffer(int width,
                       int height,
                       int format,
                       int type,
                       java.nio.Buffer pixels)
        Schedule a load for the texture data supplied in pixels. The target is always GL_TEXTURE_2D. For detailed information see glTexImage2D's internalformat, width, height, format, type, pixels parameters. The buffer is not copied!
        Parameters:
        width - width of texture
        height - height of texture
        format - specifies the GL format of the pixel data
        type - specifies the GL data type of the pixel data
        pixels - a buffer of the image data

      • postBufferWithOffset

        public void postBufferWithOffset(int xOffset,
                                 int yOffset,
                                 int width,
                                 int height,
                                 int format,
                                 int type,
                                 java.nio.Buffer pixels)
        Schedule a subimage load for the texture data supplied in pixels. The target is always GL_TEXTURE_2D. For detailed information see glTexImage2D's internalformat, width, height, format, type, pixels parameters. The buffer is not copied!
        Parameters:
        xOffset - texel offset in x-direction
        yOffset - texel offset in y-direction
        width - width of texture subimage
        height - height of texture subimage
        format - specifies the GL format of the pixel data
        type - specifies the GL data type of the pixel data
        pixels - a buffer of the image data
